meanings.definition: relating to or caused by diphtheria
meanings.sent1: The diphtherial outbreak was concerning for the community.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the diphtherial symptoms to the worried parents.
meanings.sent3: The diphtherial vaccine helped prevent the spread of the disease.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead had a diphtherial effect on the mood.
meanings.sent5: The diphtherial odor in the hospital was unmistakable and unpleasant.

meanings.sent1: Her pale face had a diphtherial look that worried her friends.
meanings.sent2: The old photographs showed the diphtherial masks worn during the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The diphtherial costume at the party was both eerie and accurate.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a diphtherial atmosphere that sent shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room had a diphtherial quality that made everyone uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The diphtherial test confirmed the presence of the bacteria.
meanings.sent2: The diphtherial ward in the hospital was strictly isolated.
meanings.sent3: The diphtherial research team worked tirelessly to find a cure.
meanings.sent4: The news report highlighted the diphtherial cases in the region.
meanings.sent5: The diphtherial history lesson taught the students about the impact of the disease.
